cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference remains 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record amounts of rain fell over 7.9 hours today with a total accumulation of 13.04mm.  It fell at 8.6 mm per hour at times and ranked 8th from our records.  The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 27.64mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 15.9 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today ranked highest for the heaviest rain with a peak rain rate of {this_max}mm per hour, lasting 2.0 hours and total rainfall of 7.99mm.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 23 November 2024, the storm lasted 23.2 hours with a total precipitation of 24.56mm reaching 6.4mm per hour at times.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This is ranked 4th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on August 26, 2025 and has lasted 9 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was on July 18, 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (207°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 79.12 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1658 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 70.1m lower than yesterday, 554.4m lower than the past week, 1658.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 713m minimum and 1594m maximum, with an average of 996.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1551.2m and 2650m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and near calm conditions. Moderate rainfall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and periods of sunshine are expected. Changeable conditions.
